thread.title: Suspected Thief Knocks Down Woman, Crashes Into Pole
thread.title_full: Suspected Thief Knocks Down Woman, Crashes Into Pole

title: Suspected Thief Knocks Down Woman, Crashes Into Pole
text:
Suspected Thief Knocks Down Woman, Crashes Into Pole October 11, 2015, 6:19 AM by Perry Groten SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
A woman was taken to the hospital after trying to prevent a suspected thief from making a clean getaway in Sioux Falls. 
Police say 23-year-old Austin Johnson stole a cash box from a business on South Minnesota Avenue just after midnight Sunday. 
Police say Johnson drove off and knocked-down the woman who tried to stop him. Johnson's vehicle then crashed into a power pole near Hy-Vee. 
Police say Johnson then ran to a friend's vehicle a few blocks away. Police arrested Johnson and his friend, 22-year-old Christopher Rave. Both are charged with DUI. 
Johnson is also charged with theft, assault and leaving the scene of an accident. 
The woman who tried to stop Johnson is expected to recover. Â© 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
